meanings.sent1: The soup had a cabbagey flavor that reminded me of my grandma's cooking.
meanings.sent2: The cabbagey aroma filled the kitchen as the vegetables simmered on the stove.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but laugh at the cabbagey smell that lingered in the air after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The room was so cabbagey, it felt like being in a vegetable garden.
meanings.sent5: The cabbagey taste was so strong, it was like eating a leafy green straight from the garden.

meanings.definition: Having the taste or smell of cabbage.
meanings.sent1: The stir-fry had a cabbagey aftertaste that lingered on my palate.
meanings.sent2: The soup was so cabbagey that it transported me back to my childhood.
meanings.sent3: She wrinkled her nose at the cabbagey smell coming from the pot on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The air in the kitchen was thick and cabbagey, making it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent5: The cabbagey flavor of the dish was overpowering, but strangely comforting at the same time.
